page.title: 01Riccall and Local Area
page.content: Our square covers most of the village of Riccall as well as several acres of farmland. The River Ouse also runs through the square. In Riccall there is a{Norman church}which was built in 1069. The disused main railway line from York to London runs through this section. In the corner is Barlby Common,we also have an old windmill at the top of the square. Just coming out of Riccall is Riccall water tower,it is 80 feet tall.By the tower runs the A19.Down in the far corner it meets the A613 by Turn Head farm.Riccall has one level crossing. A new important feature is the Riccall coal mine.Riccall mine is part of{Selby coal}field.
